title: Fixing lag
body: Anyone have tips on fixing lag on windows Anniversary edition. I've been having massive trouble since i was forced into this update.

replies.body:
If you're having problems with your FPS, then it's likely related to the *Game DVR* feature that was enabled in the Windows Game Bar by this update. I suggest you disable it with [these steps](http://www.tenforums.com/tutorials/8637-game-bar-turn-off-windows-10-a.html) to see if it fixes your issue.

Let me know if this fixed it.
I disabled that but am still having problems. Thank you for looking into it though.
Can you give me a more detailed description of the *"lag"* you're experiencing? If I have more details, I may be able to provide more steps to take.
Whenever i get more than 6 or so champs my screen keeps skipping. My fps doesn't so much as drop as i can't see anything.  My problem is this hasn't happened before the update.

When you say you *can't see anything* do you mean the screen goes black, or that you don't see anyone's actions being taken or their champs moving for a little bit, then suddenly the game catches up with what happened?
Move a little bit then snap to present.

Oh, okay. that makes a lot more sense! This is often caused by *Packet Loss*, which is where the packets that contain your information get lost in the transition to the server. Most of the time, local network settings or problematic nodes in your route cause this to happen. I suggest ensuring your local network settings are compatible with League by following our [connection guide](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues).

Let me know if those steps helped.
